attributes.action: NHS staff working in the community, there fuel allowance isn’t covering the cost
attributes.additional_details: NHS staff is our front line for the community and for some people there only way they survive. The wages aren’t amazing for those who see patients in the community from nurses midwife’s health care workers. The price of fuel and the low wages are hitting them hard
attributes.background: A sliding scale on there allowance which starts as a minimum amount then if there is an increase in fuel for more than say 2 months then it’s reviewed and back paided

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

Decisions relating to rates of reimbursement for costs incurred by staff who use their own vehicles on NHS business is an operational matter for the NHS, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You might like to sign one or more of the following petitions relating to fuel prices:

Set up an independent regulator to monitor and regulate vehicle fuel pricing
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605282

Suspend VAT on road fuels to reduce fuel costs
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610567

Remove duty on motor fuel completely
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613908
